text:
e="preserve">Donald "Don" Joseph McDermott (December 7, 1929 – November 2020) was an American speed skater. He was born in The Bronx, New York. He was at the 1952 Olympics in Oslo. He won a silver medalist in the 500 meters.
On November 2, 2020, it was announced that McDermott had died at the age of 90.
